1.content:
In a quiet little village along the countryside, there lies a farm. On the second floor of the farmhouse, a light shines though the window. It's source, a single candle resting on the floor, a young boy kneeling before, his eyes closed and his hands clasped together in prayer. In the corner of the room, watching the boy sat an old man, his hair and beard white with age, his face lined with multiple scars of battles long last, most noticeable being the one that had been slashed across his left eye, rendering it blind.

He was definitely old, but his body was still comprised of hard muscle, capable of taking on men half his age in a fight. As the boy finished his prayers, he picked the candle up from the floor and placed it on his nightstand as he climbed into bed. Turning to the old man at his bedside, the boy asked "Grandpa, will you tell me a story before sleep?" The old man smiled. His grandson was always so eager to hear tales of his glory days, so to speak.

"Surely, I must have told you of all my old adventures by now. Wouldn't you rather hear about how I met your grandmother?" The old man said, with a joking smirk. The boy shook his head "No. I want to hear about your monster slaying days. There must be something you haven't told me." The old man chuckled "Alright. I suppose I could tell you of the time I..."
1.title: Bedtime Tales

info.brief_description: A retired monster slayers recounts stories of his adventures to his grandson.
info.description: Set in a world that's sort of a mix of medieval Europe and and feudal japan, a grizzled former monster slayer is putting his young grandson to bed. Not tired, the ten year old boy asks his grandfather to tell him a story. Having spent many years of his youth traveling the world and fighting various beasts, the old man smiles. He has plenty of stories to tell. The question is, which one should be tonight's bedtime story?
